body.p: In response to concerns expressed by some respondents who pointed out that, unlike IAS 31, ED 9 did not include the term ‘investors in a joint arrangement’, the Board clarified during its redeliberation of ED 9 that not all the parties to a joint arrangement need to have joint control for the arrangement to be a joint arrangement. Indeed, some of the parties to a joint arrangement can have joint control whereas others, although able to participate, do not have joint control of the arrangement. The Board decided to use the terms ‘joint operators’ to designate parties with joint control of a ‘joint operation’ and ‘joint venturers’ to designate parties with joint control of a ‘joint venture’ (see paragraph BC24).
